column1: #' This list is used by humans to keep track of our sensitivity analyses as well as by
#' the function `run_sensitivities()` to change the model
#' group: a label for future use
#' num: a unique code for the sensitivity in question
#'      if multiple inputs need to change
#' north: TRUE/FALSE for whether the north model needs this sensitivity
#' south: TRUE/FALSE for whether the south model needs this sensitivity
#' parlabel: string that matches the parameter label
#' INIT: new INIT value (leave blank for no change)
#' PHASE: new PHASE value (leave blank for no change)
#' PRIOR: new PRIOR value (leave blank for no change)
#' PR_SD: new PR_SD value (leave blank for no change)
#' LO: new LO value (leave blank for no change)
column2: required if INIT is below the previous lower bound

column1: #' lambda_comp: the likelihood component code for use in the lambda inputs
#'   where initially the only option is to fix the lambda value at 0
#'   (but that could be generalized with an additional 'value' column)
#' lambda_fleet: the fleet to which a lambda = 0 will be applied
#' description: a description of the sensitivity that is easy to understand by humans
#' function: function within the lingcod package to run to make the change
#' dontrun: just create the follow to allow user to manually edit the files

column16: estimate a single M for both sexes with a mixture distribution of the priors
fix female M at 0.3 and h at 0.7
add all additional ages as CAAL to the south model
add all additional ages as marginal to the south model
add all fishery-independent ages as CAAL in the south model
remove fishery-dependent ages from the north model
use the combM+F option to ignore sex ratios among small fish
Change CA Rec index in recent years from onboardCPFV to CRFSPR
Change OR Rec index to onboard (CPFV ride along) index
fix the commercial FG selectivity to be asymptotic
add male offsets to selectivity (initially just Male_Scale within offset option 3)
